ygData.subject: Re: [Heritrix 2.0 snapshot] .kill: 195: No such process
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks, this does solve my problem. Not being a shell guru myself, I took the option of replacing the script headers on my local install of heritrix. Besides,

Thanks, this does solve my problem. Not being a shell guru myself, I
took t=
he option of replacing the script headers on my local install of
heritrix.
=

Besides, quoting part of your reply, I submitted issue HER-1386
"Bashisms =
in shell scripts result in ".kill: 195: No such process"
error on Ubuntu 7.=
10" on Jira.

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Erik Hetzner
<erik.he=
tzner@...> wrote:
>
> At Thu, 03 Jan 2008 15:23:40 -0000,
> "xavier_sauteje=
au" <xvrstj-registration@...> wrote:
> > 
> > I have a problem similar to t=
he one reported by "Over" on the web
> > archiving blog at
> > "http://wa.a=
rchive.org/blog/2007/12/07/heritrix-200-rc1-is-out/"
> > 
> > I am using Ub=
untu 7.10 and Java 6. Heritrix 1.12.1 works OK, but using
> > 2.0 I have so=
me issues
> >
> > [=E2=80=A6]
> 
> This problem is because the latest Ubunt=
u has switched to using dash,
> a lightweight POSIX as its primary shell (i=
.e. /bin/sh), and shell
> scripts often use bash specific constructs, assum=
ing that /bin/sh is
> bash. The #!/bin/sh at the top of Heritrix scripts sh=
ould be changed
> to read #!/bin/bash, or alternately the scripts could hav=
e the
> bashisms removed.
> 
> Here is some more info: <https://wiki.ubuntu=
.com/DashAsBinSh>
> 
> best,
> Erik Hetzner
> ;; Erik Hetzner, California D=
igital Library
> ;; gnupg key id: 1024D/01DB07E3
>
